formalMetadata.description: A page with the first few sentences of Theodor Fontane's novel "Effi Briest", in German. The html element has a lang with the value "en" (English) and an xml:lang attribute with the value "de" (German).
formalMetadata.title: Correct xml:lang and incorrect lang attribute for primary language of content in German
formalMetadata.dc:creator: Christophe.Strobbe@esat.kuleuven.be

testElement.specReference: Specifying the language of content: the lang attribute

purpose.p: This test case is intended to fail because the default human language of the content is not correctly identified: the language information is contradictory. Only the default human language is tested, not language changes inside the content.

expertGuidance.p: This test case can be evaluated automatically when using a test tool with reliable automatic language recognition for both German and English, support for lang and xml:lang attributes and language tags.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser may not be able to find the default human language of the document.

techComment.p: This test case maps to technique H57: Using language attributes on the html element
Note that when both lang and xml:lang are specified, the value of xml:lang takes precedence: see "The lang and xml:lang Attributes" in the XHTML specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#C_7).
IBM Home Page Reader 3.0 German version, set to "automatic language recognition", and JAWS 7.1, German version, tried to read the test file in English.
